intro: Draba streptobrachia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved whitlow grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, basal leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is often found in mountainous regions of Europe. Draba streptobrachia is also notable for its role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
